alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 3:01PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Osceola County through 330 PM EST... At 301 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Kissimmee, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Kissimmee, Lake Marian, Kenansville, Forever Florida, and Deer Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of brief funnel clouds. On rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
